article.headline: Northeastern 70, Maine 57
article.story: ORONO, Maine (AP) -- Northeastern broke open a tight game with a big second-half run and knocked off the Maine 70-57 Saturday. The Huskies (2-2) notched their fourth straight win over the Black Bears and second straight overall this season. Northeastern broke open a tight game and took control of the tempo by scoring eight consecutive points and taking a 43-35 lead with 14:04 left in the second half. The Huskies' streak fueled a 16-3 scoring run that effectively took the Black Bears (3-3) out of their rhythm and gave Northeastern a comfortable 51-38 edge with 9 1/2 minutes left. Maine would never get closer than 9 the rest of the way. Matt Janning led the Huskies with 17 points and seven rebounds. Eugene Spates chipped in with 15 points. Chris Alvarez had the best overall effort with 10 points, seven rebounds, five assists, three blocks and two steals. Mark Socoby and Brian Andre led Maine with 17 points apiece. Socoby also had a game-high eight rebounds. Junior Bernal finished with 14 points, six rebounds, three steals and three assists. The Huskies scored 12 points from the paint and got scoring help from four players during the game-changing run. Northeastern shot 61.9 percent from the field and hit 14 of 21 free throws in the second half to pull away. The Huskies took advantage of 19 Maine turnovers while committing just 10.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
